node.title: Wages growth defies lockdowns with small uptick in pay rises
node.alt: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph
node.description: Wages growth defies COVID lockdowns across the majority of eastern Australia during the September quarter, with bigger pay rises for most Australians.
node.content: ["Wages growth has ticked up in something closer to a pre-pandemic pattern, despite COVID lockdowns across the majority of eastern Australia during the September quarter.", "The latest figures from the Bureau of Statistics show wages rose 0.6 per cent over the quarter, seasonally adjusted, and were up 2.2 per cent over the year to September 30.", "\"Wage and salary reviews around the end of the financial year, scheduled enterprise agreements and annual award rises all contributed to growth,\" said Michelle Marquardt, the head of prices statistics at the ABS.", "\"Pockets of wage pressure continued to build for skilled construction-related, technical and business services roles, leading to larger ad hoc rises as businesses looked to retain experienced staff and attract new staff.\"", "More to come."]
